english_translation: Narrated by Aisha: Ubaidullah ibn Abdullah ibn Umar asked Aisha whether a man could have intimate relations with his menstruating wife. She said: Let her tie her lower garment tightly, then if he wishes he may have intimate relations with her.

english_translation: Narrated by the slave of Aisha: Women used to send to Aisha, the Mother of the Believers, a piece of cloth in which was cotton stained with the yellow discharge from menstruation, asking her about prayer. She would say to them: Do not be hasty until you see the white discharge. She meant the purity from menstruation.

english_translation: Narrated by the daughter of Zayd ibn Thabit: Women used to call for lamps in the middle of the night to look at their purity. She disapproved of this and said: This is not what women used to do. Malik was asked about a menstruating woman who becomes pure but does not find water - should she perform tayammum? He said: Yes, let her perform tayammum, for her case is like that of the person in a state of major ritual impurity who does not find water - he performs tayammum.

english_translation: Narrated by Asma bint Abi Bakr al-Siddiq: A woman asked the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, saying: Tell me, when the blood of menstruation touches the clothing of one of us, how should she treat it? The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: If the blood of menstruation touches the clothing of one of you, then let her scrape it, then let her rinse it with water, then let her pray in it.

english_translation: Narrated by Aisha: Fatima bint Abi Hubaysh said: O Messenger of Allah ﷺ, I do not become pure (from bleeding). Should I abandon prayer? The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said to her: That is only a vein, not menstruation. So when menstruation comes, abandon prayer, and when its duration passes, wash the blood from you and pray.

english_translation: Narrated by Um Salamah, wife of the Prophet ﷺ: A woman used to menstruate excessively during the time of the Prophet ﷺ. She sought a ruling through Um Salamah from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. He said: Let her look at the number of nights and days during which she used to menstruate in the month before this affliction befell her. Let her refrain from prayer for that duration of the month. Then when that has passed, let her perform ghusl, then let her cover herself with a cloth, then let her pray. Additionally, narrated: It was seen that Zaynab bint Jahsh, who was under Abdur-Rahman ibn Awf, had istihadah, and she used to bathe and pray.

english_translation: Narrated: Al-Qaqa' ibn Hakim and Zayd ibn Asalm sent a messenger to Saeed ibn al-Musayyab asking how a woman with istihadah (abnormal uterine bleeding) should bathe. He said: She should bathe from one purity to another, and perform wudu' for every prayer. If the blood overwhelms her, she should cover herself with a cloth.

english_translation: Narrated by Urwah from his father: There is nothing required for a woman with istihadah except to bathe once, then perform wudu' for every prayer. Yahya said: Malik said: Our position is that when a woman with istihadah prays, her husband may have relations with her, and likewise for a woman who has completed her postpartum bleeding. If she sees blood after that, her husband may have relations with her, for she is like a woman with istihadah. Malik said: Our jurisprudence on istihadah is based on the hadith of Hisham ibn Urwah from his father, and this is the most beloved to me of what I have heard in this matter.

english_translation: Chapter: What has been reported regarding urination while standing and other matters

potential_issues.issue: This is a chapter heading, not an actual hadith
potential_issues.impact: No chain of transmission to analyze - this is editorial content

IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok
Topics: Urination posture - standing and other methods

english_translation: Narrated: A Bedouin entered the mosque and exposed his genitals to urinate. The people shouted at him until their voices grew loud. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: Leave him. So they left him and he urinated. Then the Messenger of Allah ﷺ ordered buckets of water to be poured over that place. Additionally, narrated by Abdullah ibn Dinar: I saw Abdullah ibn Umar urinating while standing. Yahya said: Malik was asked about washing the genitals from urine and feces - is there any precedent for this? He said: I have heard that some of the predecessors used to perform wudu from defecation, and I prefer to wash the genitals from urine.

english_translation: Narrated: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said on one of the Fridays: O assembly of Muslims, indeed this is a day which Allah has made a festival, so bathe. Whoever has perfume, let him not harm himself by using it, and upon you is the miswak.
